title: Gwen Stefani turns 50 and her boyfriend Blake Shelton is the first to wish her a happy birthday:
text:
Gwen Stefani turned 50-years-old on Thursday and her boyfriend was one of the first people to wish her a happy birthday on social media.

Blake Shelton, 43, took to Twitter to say: 'Happy Birthday @gwenstefani!!!! I love you so much it's actually stupid… And possibly illegal in the state of California.'

The two have been dating ever since they fell for each other on the set of The Voice nearly four years ago.

But they took their time.

They started working together in 2014 on the competition show and waited seven months before they went public with their romance.

At the time, Blake was split from wife Miranda Lambert and Gwen had worked through her divorce with Gavin Rossdale.

Does she look 50? No: The siren really looks half her age so it's hard to believe she is really 50; seen in Monaco in late September

Ever since, Gwen and Blake have seemed to be very happy together as he helps her raise her three kids she had with Gavin: Kingston, 13, Zuma, 10, and Apollo, five.

In September, Stefani told the Today show that Shelton helps with her sons.

'He is a good dad, actually,' she said when Hoda Kotb asked if she thought he would be a good father.

It just works: Gwen and Blake have seemed to happy as he helps her raise her three kids she had with Gavin: Kingston, 13, Zuma, 10, and Apollo, five. In September, Stefani told Today that Shelton helps with her sons. 'He is a good dad, actually,' she said; seen in April

'He's been helping me out a lot, so I literally get to the point where I'm like, "You gotta get home, I need help." It's hard. I got three boys.'

She also acknowledged that they are from very different backgrounds.

'I just never thought in my wildest dreams, on paper, a cowboy and a ska-like girl from Anaheim would be hanging out, but it works perfect and we’re just having so much fun,' she said.

'And we just feel so blessed to be at this point in our live.'

In June she gushed again when she spoke to GMA: 'He's my homeboy. He's my homey. He's just really an amazing all-around human so I feel so grateful for that. He's inspired me so much. He's changed my life.'

The two are now working together again on The Voice after she took a break from the hit show.
